intro: Hieracium conicum subsp. lespinassei, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a compact head, typical of the Compositae family. It thrives in rocky and gravelly soils at high altitudes, often growing in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species in its native range.
